item.title: Contact Me!
item.description: The easiest way to contact me is by email: carson.ll.quigley@gmail.com. You can also find me on Linkedin or github!

item.title: Summer 2018 - Scheduling Problem in Big Data Workflows
item.description: A Brief Synopsis During the Summer of 2018 I worked with Dr. Aravind Mohan to deconstruct algorithms that attempted to solve the well known Scheduling Problem in the realm of cloud computing. This research led to my presentation of a poster detailing our work towards the end of the research period. Scheduling Problem The scheduling problem in the field of computer science and cloud computing is a problem in which there are

item.title: Summer 2017 - Postmodernist Studies
item.description: A Brief Synopsis My work over the summer of 2017 with Professor Xiaoling Shi was about postmodernism and the influances it had on the particular work, A Death In Chicago by Xianyoung. I did much reasearch on postmodernist works during the 1920’s era that may have influanced Xianyoung’s work.

item.title: First Post!
item.description: Sometimes one looks to the first post to find out what the original philosophy of the post creator was. Wonder what this post’s philosophy is..

item.title: Second Post!
item.description: When looking at posts, one often can use the first few to get an idea of not only the original goals of the project, but also an idea of how the creator was going about achieving those goals.

item.title: About
item.description: Carson Quigley Currently a student at Allegheny College, enjoys working in many programming languages such as C, Java, Python, Bash, Lua, and more! I’m a huge fan of the linux Operating System and do much of my work from my Google pixelbook running Debian with crouton! I also run ArchLinux on most of my computers including my home desktop.
